document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amiota ( Phortica ) antillaria
Chen & Toda, 1997: 789
. syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Surstylus somewhat oblong; vertical process of gonopod dilated laterally, with 1 or 2 small projection(s) mediodorsally or apically; aedeagal outer membrane mostly with numerous spinules (after Chen & Toda 1997 ).

Remarks. Chen & Toda (1997) described two variable characters as the diagnosis of
P . antillaria
, but we have not yet found sufficient morphological or molecular evidence in supporting
P . antillaria
as a different species compared with
P . foliata
.
